artist: Utagawa Kunisada Utagawa Hiroshige Published by Maruya Kyūshirō Carved by Yokogawa Takejirō
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
marks: in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga} |  廣重画 {
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: Odawara is located near Mount Hakone, in a region renowned for its natural hot springs. Here, Hiroshige shows Mount Hakone rising in the distance beyond the Sakawagawa River. In the foreground, Kunisada depicted a female visitor to the area who has just emerged from one of the hot springs and now loosely wears an informal blue and white cotton robe (<I>yukata<I>). A young girl attempts to sell the woman locally crafted toys and decorative boxes.
title: Odawara
